intro: Thalictrum montanum subsp. schleicheri, commonly known as the Alpine meadow rue, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows at higher elevations. It has a fibrous root system and produces numerous stolons, which help it spread and establish colonies. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
